item.title: DOGE's effort to slash government is now coming for buildings and people who run them
item.description: The federal government is preparing to shed up to a quarter of its 360 million square feet of real estate, an NPR analysis finds. The agency in charge...

item.title: Not sure where to go next in life? These journal prompts can help you figure it out
item.description: Whether you're thinking about starting a new career or moving to a different city, these exercises can help you make hard decisions with more confiden...

item.title: D'Wayne Wiggins, founding member of the R&B group Tony! Toni! Tone!, has died at 64
item.description: Wiggins died Friday morning after battling bladder cancer for over the past year, according to a statement released by his family on social media.

item.title: A South Carolina prisoner is the first executed by a firing squad in 15 years
item.description: A South Carolina man who killed his ex-girlfriend's parents with a baseball bat was executed by firing squad Friday, the first U.S. prisoner in 15 yea...

item.title: Trump signs executive action targeting public service loan program
item.description: The program forgives the loans of borrowers who work in public service. The executive action would exclude those who work for certain organizations.
